definition: to take possession of/to occupy/to take up

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Otherwise the astrologer should make an appropriate referral.
sentences.chinese: 否則，占星家應作出適當的轉介。

sentences.english: Both astronomers and astrologers agree on this bit.
sentences.chinese: 在這一點上天文學家和占星家暫時可以握手言和。

sentences.english: Popular astrologer Susan Miller called the news "ridiculous."
sentences.chinese: 受歡迎的占星家蘇珊米勒稱這則新聞是荒謬的。

sentences.english: Allow your astrologer to provide you with regular counseling and coaching.
sentences.chinese: 讓占星家爲你提供定期的建議和輔導。

sentences.english: You should go to an astrologer to have your horoscope read.
sentences.chinese: 你應該找一個占星家，讓他告訴你你的星象。

sentences.english: I don't believe that astrologers are able to divine.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信占星家能作預言。

definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)

Ptolemy, kings of Egypt after the partition of Alexander the Great's Empire in 305 BC/Ptolemy or Claudius Ptolemaeus (c. 90-c. 168), Alexandrian Greek astronomer, mathematician and geographer, author of the Almagest 天文學大成|天文学大成/see also 托勒玫[Tuo1 le4 mei2]

pinyin: tian1 ti3 wu4 li3 xue2 jia1

definition: Ptolemy or Claudius Ptolemaeus (c. 90-c. 168), Alexandrian Greek astronomer, mathematician and geographer, author of the Almagest 天文學大成|天文学大成/see also 托勒密[Tuo1 le4 mi4]
